page.title: 01Land North East Rillington
page.content: An area of low lying fertile farmland. Crops barley - wheat - sugar beet - potatoes - oil seed rape. Turnips and kale for sheep. Originally part of post glacial "Lake Pickering" village of Rillington quite a large village on A64 leeds to Scarborough. Rillington manor and Scampston hall relics of estate. Main railway line Malton to Scarborough bisetts block. A few shelter belts and sands wood mainly coniferous. Malsters occuply mill near Rillington. Large grain silos at West Knapton.
